circumstances: The crew was engaged in a mapping/photo mission from Walla Walla (Washington) to Libby, Montana. While cruising in poor weather conditions, the crew lost control of the airplane that dove into the ground and crashed in the region of Noxon. The wreckage was found June 16, 1972. The aircraft was totally destroyed and both pilots were killed.
probable_cause:
Uncontrolled descent caused by improper in-flight decisions or planning on part of the crew. The following factors were reported:
- Conditions conducive to carburetor/induction system icing, 
- Ice-carburetor, 
- Icing conditions including sleet and freezing rain,
- Airframe ice, 
- Complete failure of both engines, 
- Flew into icing conditions beyond capability of aircraft deicing systems.
